attributionInfo.agentName: Aparicio Team at Coldwell Banker Realty

data.description:
OWNER OCCUPANT / INVESTORS WELCOME! 

Newly renovated classic three-unit apartment building (3,774 rentable sf) in the Parkville neighborhood of Hartford offered at $410,000. Ideal opportunity for a new owner to move into the vacant ground floor three-bedroom apartment while collecting $39,000/annually on the upper floor units (existing leases).  The current rent roll pays for taxes ($563/monthly) and insurance ($120/monthly) while affording a mortgage payment of up to $2,571/monthly.   Ideal opportunity for a first time home buyer with FHA financing - 3.5% down ($14,350) and monthly mortgage payments of $2,527.  QUALIFY FOR THE MORTGAGE AND LIVE FOR FREE!  Building is also ideal for an investor who wants to rent out the ground floor and collect a steady stream of monthly income ($58,000/annually) on a low maintenance property. 

Each three-bedroom apartment is freshly painted with new flooring and includes a brand-new bathroom, new kitchen, a walk-in pantry, and fully renovated living room. Each apartment also includes a lockable storage room in the basement and a parking space in the garage.  Separate electric and gas meters for each apartment.  Potential for additional income if buyer installs a coin-operated washer/dryer on existing hook-ups in the basement.

Recent renovation work includes:
•	New roof,
•	Replacement windows,
•	New bathrooms with new fixtures,
•	New kitchens with new appliances,
•	New and refinished floors,
•	New boiler and flue liner,

The house is on a large lot with a detached garage and large trash shed. The property is fenced around its perimeter with a small fenced-off area to the side of the garage for pets. 

The property is located a half-block from the Park Street shopping corridor and 3 blocks from Parkville Station. It is minutes away from West Hartford Center, 2 parks (Pope and Kennedy Memorial Parks) and the West Boulevard exit of I-84.

Seller will pay 2 3/4% commission to buyer's real estate brokers.

Get in before the price rises! Contact the owner to schedule a showing.
